entry.title: What Remains When the Monument Falls
entry.summary:
Author: Hasunohana

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,930Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 28

Summary: The Batcave had always held secrets, but none as raw as Jason Todd’s memorial—a shrine of glass and grief, a monument to the son Bruce Wayne had failed.Now, with the Batfamily closer than ever, Bruce decides it’s time to let go of the past. When Jason is summoned to the manor, he braces for the same old cycle of guilt and discord. Instead, he finds his father standing before the memorial, tools in hand, ready to shatter that symbol of pain once and for all.As the glass fractures, Jason is forced to confront the question that’s haunted him since he clawed his way out of the grave:Who is he now——when he’s no longer the dead Robin,—no longer the failed vigilante?

entry.title: summer in Kansas
entry.summary:
Author: rednesslover

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,856Chapters: 14/18Kudos: 301

Summary: Something’s off in Gotham—Batman knows. But that’s routine. Until it threatens Damian’s safety.It’s the second time Bruce takes him away from the city. At least this time, he’s driving—not Dick. That meant something: he didn’t want to do this, but had no choice.Still, Damian is furious. Of course he is. He’s not even going to the Titans Tower—his second home, his second family. And it’s all Dick’s fault.He’s angry because he can’t joke with Beast Boy over veggie pizza, or mock BB with Jaime, or suffer through Superboy’s endless talk about fangirls, or meditate with Raven. And Kori… just thinking about her hurts. It’s not his fault, he knows, but it still feels like betrayal.Bruce wants to take him somewhere far—no crime, no pressure, no “Robin.” Just peace. At least until everything settles in Gotham. And this time, he trusts someone to help.What Damian doesn’t know is that Bruce’s mysterious “best friend”—who Damian didn’t even know existed—has a son, too.

entry.title: Knights' Song
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,111Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 99

Summary: Due to a magic-based mishap, Batman's internal dichotomy is upended into an external dynamic. The rest of the Batfam and Justice League can only watch on, both fascinated and disturbed.Or...Bruce Wayne has never had so much free time on his hands. He decides to spend it coaxing a grumpy Bat into letting himself be adopted sideways into brotherhood, meddling in his sons' lives, and messing with the Justice League. This works out better than anyone could have reasonably anticipated.

entry.title: Chronicles of having a magical girl daughter
entry.summary:
Author: Rulersr3achf4n

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 303Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: (I’m not good at summaries I’m so sorry and EXTREMELY OOC BC I SUCK AT WRITING CHARACTERS ACCURATELY STICK WITH ME) After what seems like the millionth reset by homura, madoka ends up in the same place as before but this time goes wrong, her parents and little brother, get into a car crash, and with no where to go and no one to go to, she makes her wish with Kyubey, the timeline goes as normal until Kyubey decides madokas destined for more, so sends her to Gotham, a breeding ground for witches who feed off all the hate and darkness that festers between Gothams walls, and eventually, Bruce or Batman, picks up on it, and after some convincing on both sides (madoka pretending she’s just another vigilante, and Bruce convincing her he’s a good guy) she eventually joins the family, still going out at night to fight witches without the family realizing it, or do they? This takes place around a year after Bruce adopts madoka.

entry.title: Maudlin
entry.summary:
Author: PutYourRecordsOn

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 50,223Chapters: 18/35Kudos: 74

Summary: (can be read without knowledge of Mission impossible or Batman only requires understanding of one)Before he was the IMF’s favorite tech guy, Benji Dunn was something else entirely—a medic for the League of Assassins, a reluctant part of their world, and somehow the only non-assassin adult Damian Wayne trusted. He never meant to care. He never meant to stay. And he definitely never meant to walk away from it all broken.Years later, the past doesn’t just catch up—it breaks the door down. With the Entity threatening the future, Damian and Jason back in his orbit, and Ethan Hunt watching him like he sees every secret Benji’s tried to bury, the life Benji built is starting to crack.A story of found family, sharp edges, and soft hearts. Of missions and mistakes, art and tea, and what it means to choose kindness in a world that asks you to kill.

entry.title: Of Gods and Bats
entry.summary:
Author: Splitmeadow

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 152,809Chapters: 41/?Kudos: 5,229

Summary: After Billy Batson gets attacked by something he doesn't understand, he decides to call Batman to help him find the source of the attacks. Little does he know, this sets up a series of events that will change his life forever. Billy has always been an orphan and has learned to take care of himself – but can he learn to accept help from others and really let someone know him?

entry.title: Dome Protocol
entry.summary:
Author: ToTheLastWord

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 50,013Chapters: 6/8Kudos: 387

Summary: “I think he created the device for an end-of-the-world scenario,” Bruce said, voice carefully neutral. When a mysterious device sends the Batkids' future sons and daughters to the past, right in the middle of the cave, none of them is ready. Not the new kids, whose family as they know it is back in a different time, and certainly not Bruce's own children, too young to be parents.With the six now stuck in a time in which they don't exist yet, hurt by a future that will never be, the Batkids will have to decide what it truly means to be a family and how to face the ghosts of choices not yet taken.AKAThe Batkids meet their future children and everything gets complicated.- - - -Part of a series dedicated to the Batkids' kids, this is a STAND-ALONE fic.

entry.title: All Robins Go To Therapy (Eventually)
entry.summary:
Author: v_Artemis_v

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,032Chapters: 5/35Kudos: 53

Summary: Bruce Wayne is cursed into a ten-year-old's body after trusting a suspiciously charming witch named Araya. The catch? The spell punishes him based on emotional repression, loneliness, and general Batman-ness. Cue bat ears, glittery hands, glowing skin, and the slow deterioration of Bruce’s ability to lie, isolate, or emotionally deflect.His family assumes he’s some new Robin that Batman picked up—until Barbara figures out the truth and Operation Siege Dad begins.What follows is emotional sabotage, forced sibling bonding, Mean Girls, glitter-based aggression, magical body horror, and the most unhinged Justice League debrief in Watchtower history. All in the name of saving Bruce Wayne from himself.And also turning him back into an adult. That’d be nice too.

entry.title: In Shadows We Bind Our Hearts
entry.summary:
Author: RaineKellen64

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,855Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 328

Summary: The Batkids are stuck in a time loop where Bruce sacrifices himself to save them every time. Once they break the time loop, nothing is going to stop them from keeping their dad safe, even from himself.OrThe consequences of losing your dad one too many times.OrI love platonic yandere and overprotective Batkids, so I wrote it.-----------------------I have barely read any Batman comics, but I've read a boat load of fanfiction of them. They are OOC.P.S. There is no time line. The title is temporary. This is only my second fic.

entry.title: At the end of your fall,
entry.summary:
Author: ArtyPuppet

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,709Chapters: 2/8Kudos: 129

Summary: “He didn't look like your typical upstart vigilante though, most obviously because the young man's face wasn't covered. But there were other things too, no extra colours or logos, he was all black, the only real oddity was that he was missing a shoulder guard. Perhaps it was more odd that it's his only piece of armour. The whole thing seemed, manufactured somehow, like a uniform. His outfit would be best described as practical but that still felt wrong. Batman knew practical, he knew efficient, he knew function, just ask his utility belt, but he still had ears on his cowl. Batman was a symbol. This man was nothing.Although, Bruce was looking at the man after his sword had been confiscated by Cassandra. He surely cut quite the imposing figure when he was wielding that monster.”
